dt-option.name: searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria
dt-option.summary: Declares criteria and sub-groups within the array

type.description: An array of objects which represent either a sub-group or a criteria.

dt-option.default: The default value for the `-init searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria` option is `[]` meaning that as standard there are no criteria or sub-groups defined.
dt-option.description:
This property is used to define sub-groups and criteria within the `-init searchBuilder.preDefined` option.
It is possible within this option to define a mix of both sub-groups and criteria. This is because a single group can hold multiple sub-groups and/or criteria at the same time
To add a sub-group an object should be added that is in the same form as `-init searchBuilder.preDefined`. This in turn can hold its own criteria and sub-groups nested to any depth you desire.
To add a criteria an object with the following properties should be defined:
* `-init searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria.data` The data that is to be selected from the `-tag select` element. * `-init searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria.condition` The condition that is to be selected from the `-tag select` element. * `-init searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria.value` The condition that is to be applied, be it to either a `-tag select` element, input or date selector.
When it comes to applying the selected `data`, `condition` and `value` values to a condition, SearchBuilder will work through them in that order and stop as soon as one is not defined. For example if you defined `data` and `value` but not `condition` then the data selection would be made, but the value would not as the condition can not be determined.
When using predefined searches with server-side processing there are two additional properties that must be set:
* `-init searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria.origData` The original field name that the server-side script should filter on. * `-init searchBuilder.preDefined.criteria.type` The type of conditions that should be used when filtering this data.
For more information on preDefined searches please refer to the `-init searchBuilder.preDefined` option or the [manual page](//datatables.net/extensions/searchbuilder/predefined).
